content: Critical infrastructure (CI) encompasses machinery, facilities, and information crucial for governance, public health, and the economy. Adverse events can result from loss or disruption of CI systems, whether due to natural disasters or deliberate attacks. This report outlines four key areas of policy concern for Congress: defining and identifying CI, understanding and assessing CI risk, federal organization for CI, and the role of the private sector. Presidential Decision Directive 63 (PDD-63) on critical infrastructure protection, issued in 1998, was the first significant policy in this area.
